intro: Bartlettina silvicola, commonly known as the Florida hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. It typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Bartlettina silvicola is often found in swampy habitats and is an important component of the region's flora.
